sources.description: captures the list of source qualifiers

caDomainId.description: Identifier for a Linear source.  Similar to ATSC SI sourceId Range(0-0xFFFF).  Though 0-0xFFF is another range that exists.

sourceId.description: Identifier for a Linear source.  Similar to ATSC SI sourceId Range(0-0xFFFF).  Though 0-0xFFF is another range that exists.

status.description: status of the object. GET only parameter

contentQualityMode.description: Captures the content quality for enabling any special encryption. (e.g.) HD content security will indicate special encryption for uDTA

sourceSecurities.description: List of source security effective on the source.  If more than one item with same Effective Time is encountered, the one with more stringent security level will be used.

items.description: captures the source security level applied to a source

securityMode.description: Mode of security for the source

effectiveTime.description: captures the effective time for the sourceSecurity to be effected. If omitted is assumed from NOW

SCC_SourceParams.description: Captures Source specific parameters configured for SCP/SCC CAS

DTA_applicable.description: Indicates if the source is available for DTAs

SCC_Mode.description: SCC Mode assigned to a given source, ignored if DTA_applicable is false.

isDLNA.description: Indicates if the source is available on DLNA output, ignored if DTA_applicable is false.

acRef.description: acRef generated by PKC for the source. only a GET parameter.  ignored if supplied on POST/PUT

isUsed.description: indicates if this is setup on the ECMG sub-system for query from CCAP/SCS.  False, when extAc is used.

extend.description: Reference Access Criteria value used as lookup index

extAcRefs.description: extAcRef supplied into PKC to prep up the ECMG for SCS query.  When extAcRef is supplied internal acRef will not be adminstered on ECMG for lookup.

items.description: extAcRef supplied into PKC to prep up the ECMG for SCS query. Generally supplied with CaSystemId adminstered. When extAcRef is supplied internal acRef will not be adminstered on ECMG for lookup.

acRefValue.description: Reference Access Criteria value used as lookup index

casSubSystemId.description: CA SubSystem ID = user customized for a given region
